sen.j: 出町柳駅（でまちやなぎえき）は、京都市左京区田中上柳町・下柳町にある、京阪電気鉄道・叡山電鉄の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Tanaka Kamiyanagi-cho/Shimoyanagi-cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Demachiyanagi Station is a stop, which is operated by Keihan Electric Railway and Eizan Electric Railway Co.,Ltd.
Demachiyanagi Station, located in Tanaka Kamiyanagi-cho/Shimoyanagi-cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, is a stop operated by the Keihan Electric Railway and the Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd.
Demachiyanagi Station, located in Tanaka Kamiyanagi-cho/Shimoyanagi-cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, is a stop operated by the Keihan Electric Railway and the Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 京阪電鉄では、京都における同社路線の終端駅であることから、「京都出町柳駅」と案内する事があったが、2003年秋のダイヤ改正以降はあまり使われなくなった。
sen.e: Because this station is the terminal station for Keihan Electric Railway in Kyoto Prefecture, it used to be called "Kyoto Demachiyanagi Station," which has hardly ever been used since the timetable revision in fall 2003.

Because this station is the terminal for the Keihan Electric Railway in Kyoto Prefecture, it used to be called "Kyoto Demachiyanagi Station," but that name has rarely been used since the timetable revision that occurred in fall 2003.

Because this station is the terminal for the Keihan Electric Railway in Kyoto Prefecture, it used to be called 'Kyoto Demachiyanagi Station,' but that name has rarely been used since the timetable revision that occurred in fall 2003.

sen.j: 鞍馬の火祭開催時は、鉄道の輸送力や鞍馬集落への収容に限りがあるため叡山電鉄出町柳駅で入場制限が行われる。
sen.e: When the Kurama Fire Festival is held, the admission is restricted at Demachiyanagi Station of Eizan Electric Railway since the transportation capacity of the railway and the capacity of Kurama area are limited.

When the Kurama Fire Festival is held, the admission is restricted at Demachiyanagi Station for the Eizan Electric Railway because the transportation capacity of the railway and the capacity of Kurama area are limited.

When the Kurama Fire Festival is held, the admission is restricted at Demachiyanagi Station for the Eizan Electric Railway because the transportation capacity of the railway and the capacity of Kurama area are limited.

sen.j: その為、発生する行列は、京阪出町柳駅の地下階段のあたりにまで長く伸びる。
sen.e: The line to join this festival extends up to the underground stairway of Demachiyanagi Station of Keihan Electric Railway.
The line to join this festival extends up to the underground stairway of Demachiyanagi Station of the Keihan Electric Railway.
The line to join this festival extends up to the underground stairway of Demachiyanagi Station of the Keihan Electric Railway.

sen.j: 京阪電気鉄道
sen.e: Keihan Electric Railway
Keihan Electric Railway

sen.j: 京阪鴨東線 ※終着駅

sen.j: 叡山電鉄
sen.e: Eizan Electric Railway
sen.cmt: 「 Co.,Ltd.」は意図的に省きました。
sen.e: Eizan Electric Railway
Eizan Electric Railway

sen.j: 叡山電鉄叡山本線 ※始終着駅
sen.e: Eizan (Main) Line, Eizan Electric Railway *starting and terminal station
Eizan (Main) Line, Eizan Electric Railway *starting and terminal station
Eizan (Main) Line, Eizan Electric Railway *starting and terminal station

sen.j: 駅舎は地下にある京阪電鉄への入口と、地上にある叡山電鉄の駅が一体となった構造である。
sen.e: The station building has a structure in which the underground entrance for Keihan Electric Railway and the aboveground entrance for Eizan Electric Railway are integrated.
The station building has a structure in which the underground entrance for the Keihan Electric Railway is integral with the aboveground entrance for the Eizan Electric Railway.
The station building has a structure in which the entrance for the underground Keihan Electric Railway is integral with that for the aboveground Eizan Electric Railway.
sen.cmt: 「地下にある京阪」「地上にある叡山鉄道」という表現にしました。

sen.j: 地上1階に叡山電鉄のホームおよび駅施設・京阪の入口・バスターミナル、地下1階に京阪のコンコース、地下2階に京阪のホームがある。
sen.e: The platforms and station facilities of Eizan Electric Railway, and the entrance for Keihan Electric Railway are located on the ground-floor level, the concourse of Keihan Electric Railway is located on the first basement level, and the platforms of Keihan Electric Railway is located on the second basement level.

The platforms and station facilities of the Eizan Electric Railway, as well as the entrance for the Keihan Electric Railway, are located on the ground-floor level; the concourse of the Keihan Electric Railway is located on the first basement level, and the platforms of the Keihan Electric Railway are located on the second basement level.

The platforms and station facilities of the Eizan Electric Railway, the entrance for the Keihan Electric Railway as well as the bus terminal, are located on the ground-floor level; the concourse of the Keihan Electric Railway is located on the first basement level, and the platforms of the Keihan Electric Railway are located on the second basement level.
sen.cmt: バスターミナルを追加しました。

sen.j: 京阪の改札は、北側の叡電口と南の今出川口の2ヶ所があるが、今出川口は改札外のコンコースで繋がっておらず独立した改札になっている（鴨川への雨水用下水道幹線が今出川通りの下を通っているため）。
sen.e: There are two ticket wickets of Keihan Electric Railway; Eiden-guchi on the north and Imadegawa-guchi on the south; however, Imadegawa-guchi is not connected to the outside concourse and thus is an independent ticket wicket (because the major sewage waterway for rainwater to Kamo-gawa River runs under the Imadegawa-dori Street).

There are two ticket wickets of the Keihan Electric Railway: Eiden-guchi on the north and Imadegawa-guchi on the south; however, Imadegawa-guchi isn't connected to the outside concourse and thus is an independent ticket wicket (because the major sewage waterway for rainwater to the Kamo-gawa River runs under Imadegawa-dori Street).

There are two ticket gates of the Keihan Electric Railway: Eiden-guchi on the north and Imadegawa-guchi on the south; however, Imadegawa-guchi isn't connected to the outside concourse and thus is an independent ticket gate (because the major sewage waterway for rainwater to the Kamo-gawa River runs under Imadegawa-dori Street).
sen.cmt: wickets→ gates と統一しています。

sen.j: 京阪の叡電口はその名の通り、叡電の駅と一体となっている。
sen.e: Eiden-guchi of Keihan Electric Railway, as its name indicates, is integrated with the station of Eizan Electric Railway.
Eiden-guchi of the Keihan Electric Railway, as its name indicates, is integral with the station of Eizan Electric Railway.
Eiden-guchi of the Keihan Electric Railway, as its name indicates, is integral with the station of Eizan Electric Railway.

sen.j: 駅情報
sen.e: Station information
Station information
Station information

sen.j: プラットホーム形状と配置1面2線のホームを持つ地下駅。
sen.e: It is an underground station having an island platform, both sides of which are used for boarding and exiting trains.
sen.cmt: 「プラットホーム形状と配置1面2線のホーム」とはどういうものか下記などを参考に調べましたが、明確に理解できませんでした。（同じ1面2線でも何種類かの形態が存在しますし、「プラットホーム形状と配置」とは何かも、よく分かりませんでした。）「島式ホームで、その両面を乗降に使用する形態」という訳出を致しました。http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%83%97%E3%83%A9%E3%83%83%E3%83%88%E3%83%9B%E3%83%BC%E3%83%A0
sen.e: It is an underground station having an island platform, both sides of which are used for boarding and exiting trains.
It is an underground station having an island platform with two tracks.
sen.cmt: with two tracks と統一しました。

sen.j: 改札口は北寄りの「叡電口」と、南寄りの「今出川口」がある。
sen.e: There are two ticket wickets; "Eiden-guchi" on the north and "Imadegawa-guchi" on the south.
There are two ticket wickets: "Eiden-guchi" on the north and "Imadegawa-guchi" on the south.
There are two ticket gates: "Eiden-guchi" on the north and "Imadegawa-guchi" on the south.
sen.cmt: wickets→ gates と統一しています。

sen.j: 今出川通と川端通の交差点4隅に4つの出入り口があるが、うち南側の2ヶ所のみが今出川口であり、北側2つの出入り口は地下1階の叡電口の改札コンコースに繋がっている。
sen.e: Each corner at the intersection of Imadegawa-dori and Kawabata-dori Streets has an entry and exit point, but only two of the points located on the south side are connected to Imadegawa-guchi and the other two points on the north side are connected to the concourse of the Eiden-guchi ticket wicket.

Each corner at the intersection of Imadegawa-dori and Kawabata-dori Streets has an entry and exit point, but only two of the points located on the south side are connected to Imadegawa-guchi; the other two points on the north side are connected to the concourse of the Eiden-guchi ticket wicket.

Each corner at the intersection of Imadegawa-dori and Kawabata-dori Streets has an entry and exit point, but only two of the points located on the south side are connected to Imadegawa-guchi; the other two points on the north side are connected to the concourse of the Eiden-guchi ticket gate.
sen.cmt: wickets→ gates と統一しています。

sen.j: 改札口のある地下1階は叡電口側と今出川口側に分断されており、ホームを通じてしか行き来ができない。
sen.e: The first basement level which has the ticket wickets is divided into the Eiden-guchi side and the Imadegawa-guchi side, and thus coming and going between these two ticket wickets are available only by using the platform.

The first basement level, which has the ticket wickets, is divided into the Eiden-guchi side and the Imadegawa-guchi side, so it's only possible to come and go between these two ticket wickets by using the platform.

The first basement level, which has the ticket gates, is divided into the Eiden-guchi side and the Imadegawa-guchi side, so it's only possible to come and go between these two ticket gates by using the platform.
sen.cmt: wickets→ gates と統一しています。

sen.j: 今出川口改札は700～2100の時間帯のみ利用が可能である。
sen.e: The Imadegawa-guchi ticket wicket is only available between 7:00 and 21:00.
The Imadegawa-guchi ticket wicket is only available between 7:00 and 21:00.
The Imadegawa-guchi ticket gate is only available between 7:00 and 21:00.
sen.cmt: wickets→ gates と統一しています。

sen.j: 道路からほぼ平面の叡山電鉄駅舎内から叡電口コンコースへの通路と、叡電口コンコースからホームへはエレベータが設置されており車椅子等での移動が可能。
sen.e: Elevators are available from the Eizan Electric Railway station building which is located almost on the ground level to the Eiden-guchi concourse, and from the Eiden-guchi concourse to the platform, allowing people to use a wheelchair and others.

Elevators are available from the Eizan Electric Railway station building, which is located almost on the ground level to the Eiden-guchi concourse, and from the Eiden-guchi concourse to the platform, allowing people to use a wheelchair and others.

Elevators are available from the Eizan Electric Railway station building, which is located almost on the ground level to the Eiden-guchi concourse, and from the Eiden-guchi concourse to the platform, allowing people to use a wheelchair and others.

sen.j: 当駅は始発駅なので以前は、発車メロディ（特急・K特急の場合は「牛若丸」）が流れていたが、2007年6月17日から向谷実作曲による発車メロディが導入されている（K特急の発車のさいは「京阪特急 (楽曲)」が使用されている）。
sen.e: Because this station is the starting station, departure music has been adopted; "Ushiwakamaru" used to be used for Limited Express and K-Ltd. Express trains, and since June 17, 2007, music composed by Minoru MUKAIYA ("Keihan Tokkyu (music)" for K-Ltd. Express trains) has been used.

Because this is the starting station, departure music has been adopted: "Ushiwakamaru" was formerly used for limited express and K-limited express trains, and since June 17, 2007 music composed by Minoru MUKAIYA ("Keihan Tokkyu (music)" for K-limited express trains) has been used.

Because this is the starting station, a unique departure melody was previously used (for limited express and K-limited express trains, a melody called 'Ushiwakamaru' was used), but since June 17, 2007 a departure melody composed by Minoru MUKAIYA has been used (for K-limited express trains, 'Keihan Tokkyu (music)' has been used).
sen.cmt: 翻訳を一部修正しました。

sen.j: 両ホームとも8両編成の停車が可能。
sen.e: Both platforms can support 8-car trains.
Both platforms can support eight-car trains.
Both platforms can support eight-car trains.

sen.j: K特急や特急は通常は2番線からの発車となる。
sen.e: Limited Express and K-Ltd. Express trains usually start from Platform 2.
Limited express and K-limited express trains usually start from platform 2.
Limited express and K-limited express trains usually start from Platform 2.
sen.cmt: Platform と大文字にしました。

sen.j: 当駅の大阪寄りに引き上げ線が1線あり、折り返し列車の調整などで使用する。
sen.e: There is a lead track on the Osaka side of this station, which is used for, for example, adjusting shuttle trains.
There is a lead track on the Osaka side of this station, which is used, for example, to adjust shuttle trains.
There is a lead track on the Osaka side of this station, which is used, for example, to adjust shuttle trains.

tit.j: 特急・K特急の乗車扱い
tit.e: Boarding Limited Express and K-Ltd. Express trains
Boarding limited express and K-limited express trains
Boarding limited express and K-limited express trains

sen.j: 特急・K特急は当駅到着時に少し手前の停車位置に止まり、乗客を全部降ろしてから一旦ドアを閉め、車内整理（転換クロスシート座席の向きを変える）を行ってから少し前進して本来の乗車位置でドアを開けて乗客扱いを行う。
sen.e: Limited Express and K-Ltd. Express trains once stop at stop position located short of the actual stop position to let all passengers get off the train, and all doors are closed to organize the inside of the cars (change the direction of the rotating cross seats), and then the train moves forward to the actual stop position and the doors are opened to let passengers get on the train.

Limited express and K-limited express trains stop at a point short of the actual stop position to let all passengers get off the train, and all doors are closed to organize the inside of the cars (change the direction of the rotating cross seats), after which the train moves forward to the actual stop position and the doors are opened to let passengers board the train.

Limited express and K-limited express trains stop at a point short of the actual stop position to let all passengers get off the train, and all doors are closed to organize the inside of the cars (change the direction of the rotating cross seats), after which the train moves forward to the actual stop position and the doors are opened to let passengers board the train.

sen.j: これは乗車と降車のドア扱いを分離する目的があるほか、車内に乗客がいる状態で転換クロスシートの自動転換作業を行うと危険であるという理由もある。
sen.e: The purposes of stopping the train at two different positions are to separate doors for boarding and exiting, as well as to protect passengers from an accident due to the automatic rotating cross seats.

The purposes of stopping the train at two different positions are to separate the doors for boarding and exiting, as well as to protect passengers from accidents due to the automatically rotating cross seats.

The purposes of stopping the train at two different positions are to separate the doors for boarding and exiting, as well as to protect passengers from accidents due to the automatically rotating cross seats.

sen.j: なお、テレビカー設置車両（京阪8000系電車および京阪3000系電車の5号車）のみ、進行方向に対して後ろ向きに転換される（テレビの設置方向にあわせるため）。
sen.e: The seats of a car with a TV set (Car 5 of Keihan Electric Railway Series 8000 and Keihan Electric Railway Series 3000) are rotated adversely toward the travelling direction (to bring the direction in line with the location of the TV set).

The seats of a car with a TV set (Car 5 of the Keihan Electric Railway Series 8000 and Keihan Electric Railway Series 3000) are rotated adversely toward the travel direction (to bring the direction in line with the placement of the TV set).

The seats of a car with a TV set (Car 5 of the Keihan Electric Railway Series 8000 and Keihan Electric Railway Series 3000) are rotated adversely toward the travel direction (to bring the direction in line with the placement of the TV set).

sen.j: ただし、折り返し時間の短い一部のK特急やダイヤが乱れたときなどはこの取り扱いを行わず、車内の座席転換は乗客に任せる。
sen.e: However, for some K-Ltd. Express trains or trains whose schedule is set back, this series of operations is not performed and the seats are rotated by each passenger, instead.
However, for some K-limited express trains or trains whose schedules are set back, this series of operations isn't performed and the seats are instead rotated by each passenger.
However, for some K-limited express trains or trains whose schedules are set back, this series of operations isn't performed and the seats are instead rotated by each passenger.

sen.j: また、車庫から回送されてくる特急列車や、大阪寄の引上線で留置後にホームに入線する特急列車では、降車客はいないのでこの扱いは行われない。
sen.e: This series of operations is also not performed for Limited Express trains that are driven from the train depot to the station directly and have been stayed on the lead track on the Osaka side before sent to the platform because no passengers are on the train.

This series of operations is also not performed for limited express trains that are driven from the train depot to the station directly and have remained on the lead track on the Osaka side before being sent to the platform because no passengers are on the train.

This series of operations is also not performed for limited express trains that are driven from the train depot to the station directly and have remained on the lead track on the Osaka side before being sent to the platform because no passengers are on the train.

sen.j: なお、座席転換作業の必要がない車両（固定クロスシートの京阪9000系電車やロングシートの京阪6000系電車・京阪7200系電車を使用する列車）であっても、乗降客分離のための停車位置変更は必ず行っている。
sen.e: Incidentally, the operation to stop trains twice at different position is always executed even for trains formed with cars for which the seat rotation is not required (Keihan Electric Railway Series 9000 with fixed cross seats, and Keihan Electric Railway Series 6000 and Keihan Electric Railway Series 7200 with long seats) for the purpose of separating the boarding and exiting passengers.

Incidentally, the operation to stop trains twice at different positions is always executed even for trains comprising cars for which seat rotation is not required (Keihan Electric Railway Series 9000 with fixed cross seats, and Keihan Electric Railway Series 6000 and Keihan Electric Railway Series 7200 with long seats) for the purpose of separating the boarding and exiting passengers.

Incidentally, the operation to stop trains twice at different positions is always executed even for trains comprising cars for which seat rotation is not required (Keihan Electric Railway Series 9000 with fixed cross seats, and Keihan Electric Railway Series 6000 and Keihan Electric Railway Series 7200 with long seats) for the purpose of separating the boarding and exiting passengers.

sen.j: 但し、京阪8000系電車や京阪3000系電車を使用する当駅行き特急・K特急が到着後、大阪方面行き急行として折り返す場合は、この扱いは行わない。
sen.e: There are exceptional cases where the operation to stop trains twice at different position is not executed, specifically when a Limited Express or K-Ltd. Express train with Keihan Electric Railway Series 8000 and 3000 returns to the direction of Osaka as an Express train after stopping at this station.

There are exceptional cases where the operation to stop trains twice at different positions isn't executed, specifically when a limited express or a K-limited express train of the Keihan Electric Railway Series 8000 or 3000 returns to the direction of Osaka as an express train after stopping at this station.

There are exceptional cases where the operation to stop trains twice at different positions isn't executed, specifically when a limited express or a K-limited express train of the Keihan Electric Railway Series 8000 or 3000 returns to the direction of Osaka as an express train after stopping at this station.

sen.j: 頭端式ホーム4面3線のホームを持つ地上駅である。
sen.e: It is an aboveground station which has a toothed platform with 4 teeth and 3 tracks.
sen.cmt: 「4面3線」は、ホームの形を「歯」または「櫛」にたとえており、その出っ張った部分が4本で列車が入線できる線路の数が3本という意味だと考えら得ますので、そのような訳し方と致しました。
sen.e: It is an aboveground station having a toothed platform with four teeth and three tracks.
It is an aboveground station having four toothed platforms with three tracks.
sen.cmt: four toothed platform としました。

sen.j: 改札は1か所で、駅員配置駅となっており、自動改札機も設置されている（入場券は発売されておらず、入場のみ利用の場合は駅係員に申し出れば可能である）。
sen.e: There is a ticket wicket with some automatic ticket checkers as well as some station attendants (no platform ticket is available, but it is possible to go to the platform to see someone off by telling so to the station attendant).

There is a ticket wicket with some automatic ticket checkers as well as some station attendants (no platform ticket is available, but it's possible to go to the platform to see someone off by informing the station attendant).
It is a manned ticket gate with some automatic ticket checkers (no platform ticket is available, but it's possible to go to the platform to see someone off by informing the station attendant).
sen.cmt: wickets→ gates と統一しています。

sen.j: 駅舎2階部分に、TSUTAYA叡電出町柳駅店があり、叡山電鉄がフランチャイズ営業を行っている。
sen.e: There is TSUTAYA Eizan Demachiyanagi Station branch store, whose franchise right is owned by Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd., on the second floor of the station building.
There is a TSUTAYA Eizan Demachiyanagi Station branch store, whose franchise right is owned by the Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd., on the second floor of the station building.
There is a TSUTAYA Eizan Demachiyanagi Station branch store, whose franchise right is owned by the Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd., on the second floor of the station building.

sen.j: その先西側の京都バスターミナルに面した側にはロッテリアがあり、かつては、構内1番線ホーム側からも利用できる構造となっていた。
sen.e: There is a Lotteria shop on the west side down the road on the side facing the Kyoto bus terminal, which used to be available from Platform 1 in the station.
There is a Lotteria shop on the west side down the road on the side facing the Kyoto bus terminal, which used to be available from platform 1 in the station.
There is a Lotteria shop on the west side down the road on the side facing the Kyoto bus terminal, which used to be available from Platform 1 in the station.
sen.cmt: Platform と大文字にしました。

sen.j: 京阪の駅の出入口はメインのものが叡電の改札前にあり上下エスカレータが備わっているほか、エレベータは南西側の角近くにある。
sen.e: The major gateways to Keihan Electric Railway are located in front of the ticket wicket of Eizan Electric Railway and up and down escalators are available and there is an elevator near the southwest corner.

The major gateways to the Keihan Electric Railway are located in front of the ticket wicket of the Eizan Electric Railway; up and down escalators are available, and there is an elevator near the southwest corner.

The major gateways to the Keihan Electric Railway are located in front of the ticket gate of the Eizan Electric Railway; up and down escalators are available, and there is an elevator near the southwest corner.
sen.cmt: wickets→ gates と統一しています。

sen.j: 駅前の道路から構内はごくゆるいスロープになっていて、その先ホームまでは平面で、車椅子等での移動は容易である。
sen.e: A gently-inclined ramp connects the road in front of the station and the station premise, and a flat access aisle extends to the platforms, allowing people to move easily in a wheelchair.
A gently inclined ramp connects the road in front of the station and the station premises, while a flat access aisle extends to the platforms, providing easy movement for people in wheelchairs.
A gently inclined ramp connects the road in front of the station and the station premises, while a flat access aisle extends to the platforms, providing easy movement for people in wheelchairs.

sen.j: 現在は、京阪鴨東線開業時に建設された新駅舎に隠されて表からは見えなくなったが、もともとの駅舎は仏堂形式の歴史ある建築物である。
sen.e: Although currently unseen head-on because hid by the new station building built as the Keihan Oto Line was opened to traffic, the original station building is a historic piece of architecture having a Buddhist-temple structure.

Although currently unseen head-on because it's hidden by the new station building that was built to coincide with the opening of the Keihan Oto Line to traffic, the original station building is a historic piece of architecture having the structure of a Buddhist temple.

Although currently unseen head-on because it's hidden by the new station building that was built to coincide with the opening of the Keihan Oto Line to traffic, the original station building is a historic piece of architecture having the structure of a Buddhist temple.

sen.j: 現在も、ホーム側の先からは旧駅舎を見ることができる。
sen.e: Even now, it can be seen from the top side of the platforms.
Even now, it can be seen from the top side of the platforms.
Even now, it can be seen from the top side of the platforms.

sen.j: 1番線ホームは1両のみ、2・3番線ホームは2両編成の停車が可能である。
sen.e: The capacity of Platform 1 is only for a train with a car, while that of Platforms 2 and 3 is for a train with 2 cars.
The capacity of platform 1 is only for a train with a car, while that of platforms 2 and 3 is for a train with two cars.
The capacity of Platform 1 is only for a train with a car, while that of Platforms 2 and 3 is for a train with two cars.
sen.cmt: Platform と大文字にしました。

sen.j: なお、上屋が完全に整備されておらず、2両編成の場合は2両目が上屋からはみ出る。
sen.e: Incidentally, the shed does not completely cover the entire area; therefore, the second car of a 2-car train runs out of the shed.
Incidentally, the shed doesn't completely cover the entire area; therefore, the second car of a two-car train protrudes from the shed.
Incidentally, the shed doesn't completely cover the entire area; therefore, the second car of a two-car train protrudes from the shed.

sen.j: 1925年（大正14年）9月27日 京都電燈の出町柳駅開業。
sen.e: September 27, 1925: Demachiyanagi Station operated by Kyoto Dento began services.
September 27, 1925: Demachiyanagi Station, operated by Kyoto Dento, began services.
September 27, 1925: Demachiyanagi Station, operated by Kyoto Dento, began services.

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）3月2日 京都電燈が鉄道事業を京福電気鉄道に譲渡。
sen.e: March 2, 1942: Kyoto Dento passed the right of railway business to Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.
March 2, 1942: Kyoto Dento passed the right of railway business to Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.
March 2, 1942: Kyoto Dento passed the right of railway business to Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 京福電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: Accordingly, the station belonged to Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.
Accordingly, the station belonged to Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.
Accordingly, the station belonged to Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 1986年（昭和61年）4月1日 京福電気鉄道が叡山電鉄に鉄道事業を譲渡。
sen.e: April 1, 1986: Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd. passed the right of railway business to Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd.
April 1, 1986: Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., passed the right of railway business to Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd.
April 1, 1986: Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., passed the right of railway business to Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 叡山電鉄の駅となる。
sen.e: Accordingly, the station belonged to Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd.
Accordingly, the station belonged to Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd.
Accordingly, the station belonged to Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 1989年（平成元年）10月5日 京阪電気鉄道の出町柳駅開業。
sen.e: October 5, 1989: Demachiyanagi Station operated by Keihan Electric Railway began services.
October 5, 1989: Demachiyanagi Station, operated by Keihan Electric Railway, began services.
October 5, 1989: Demachiyanagi Station, operated by Keihan Electric Railway, began services.

sen.j: 1993年（平成5年）6月24日 「京阪出町柳ビル」竣工、ビル内に叡山電鉄本社移転。
sen.e: June 24, 1993: "Keihan Demachiyanagi Building" was completed and the headquarters of Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd. Was transferred to the building.
June 24, 1993: "Keihan Demachiyanagi Building" was completed and the headquarters of Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd., were transferred to the building.
June 24, 1993: 'Keihan Demachiyanagi Building' was completed and the headquarters of Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd., were transferred to the building.

sen.e: The northern area between Takano-gawa River and Kamo-gawa River has been a quiet residential area where for a long time
sen.cmt: 「賀茂川」は「鴨川」の間違いであると判断いたしました。（仮に「賀茂川」であっても読みが同じであれば、英訳上は問題なしと致しました。）
sen.e: The northern area between the Takano-gawa and Kamo-gawa rivers has been a quiet residential area for a long time.
The northern area between the Takano-gawa and Kamo-gawa rivers has been a quiet residential area for a long time.

sen.j: 地上駅舎前から橋を2本渡った先、賀茂川～河原町通はかつて京都電気鉄道（のち京都市電）出町線の終点があった所で、「種屋」「苗屋」と呼ばれる、農耕・園芸用品を扱う商店が広い道路の両側に並んでいたが、今は閉店している所が多い。
sen.e: Demachi Line of Kyoto Denki Tetsudo (later Kyoto City Trams) used to be located in the area between Kamo-gawa River and Kawaramachi-dori Street, two bridges ahead from the aboveground station, and many shops called "Taneya" or "Naeya," selling agricultural and horticultural goods, were standing side by side on both sides on the wide street but many of them no longer open their shops.
sen.cmt: 「賀茂川」は「鴨川」の間違いであると判断いたしました。（仮に「賀茂川」であっても読みが同じであれば、英訳上は問題なしと致しました。）
sen.e: The Demachi Line of Kyoto Denki Tetsudo (later Kyoto City Trams) was once located in the area between the Kamo-gawa River and Kawaramachi-dori Street, two bridges ahead from the aboveground station, and many shops called "Taneya" or "Naeya," selling agricultural and horticultural goods, stood on both sides on the wide street; however, many of these shops are no longer open.

The Demachi Line of Kyoto Denki Tetsudo (later Kyoto City Trams) was once located in the area between the Kamo-gawa River and Kawaramachi-dori Street, two bridges ahead from the aboveground station building, and many shops called 'Taneya' or 'Naeya,' selling agricultural and horticultural goods, stood on both sides on the wide street; however, many of these shops are no longer open.

sen.j: 上記のほかに出町柳駅～高野車庫を運行している。
sen.e: Other than above, services between Demachiyanagi Station and Takano Shako are available.
In addition to the above, services between Demachiyanagi Station and Takano Shako are available.
In addition to the above, services between Demachiyanagi Station and Takano Shako-depot are available.

sen.j: 1989年の京阪鴨東線が開業するまでは大半が三条駅 (京都府)発着であり、三条京阪～出町柳駅まではリレーバスと称されている時期があった。
sen.e: Until the Keihan Oto Line was opened to traffic in 1989, most buses had started from and arrived at Sanjo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and there had been some buses called "relay buses" between Sanjo Keihan and Demachiyanagi Station.

Until the Keihan Oto Line opened to traffic in 1989, most buses started from and arrived at Sanjo Station (Kyoto Prefecture), and there were some buses called "relay buses" between Sanjo Keihan and Demachiyanagi Station.

Until the Keihan Oto Line opened to traffic in 1989, most buses arrived at and departed from Sanjo Station (Kyoto Prefecture), and there were some buses called "relay buses" between Sanjo Keihan and Demachiyanagi Station.
sen.cmt: "started from and arrived at"→"arrived at and departed from"に変更しました。

sen.j: その当時は、京都バスで三条京阪 - 出町柳駅を乗車して叡山電鉄に乗り継ぐ場合ならびにその逆経路の場合、乗継割引が適用されていた（三条京阪からは乗車前に叡山電鉄連絡割引乗車券を京都バス案内所で購入、叡山電鉄からは出町柳駅改札で京都バスの割引乗車券を購入する方式だった）。
sen.e: At that time, connection discount was available when a person took a Kyoto Bus from a bus stop between Sanjo Keihan and Demachiyanagi Station and then transferred to a train of Eizan Electric Railway or the reverse route (From Sanjo Keihan, the person was supposed to buy a Eizan Electric Railway connection discount ticket before taking a bus; on the contrary, he/she was supposed to buy a Kyoto Bus discount ticket at the ticket wicket of Demachiyanagi Station when connecting from a train of Eizan Electric Railway to a Kyoto Bus).

At that time, a connection discount was available when a person took a Kyoto Bus from a stop between Sanjo Keihan and Demachiyanagi Station and then transferred to a train of the Eizan Electric Railway or took the reverse route (from Sanjo Keihan, the person was supposed to buy an Eizan Electric Railway connection discount ticket before taking a bus; on the contrary, he/she was supposed to buy a Kyoto Bus discount ticket at the ticket wicket of Demachiyanagi Station when connecting from a train of the Eizan Electric Railway to a Kyoto Bus).

At that time, a connection discount was available when a person took a Kyoto Bus from a stop between Sanjo Keihan and Demachiyanagi Station and then transferred to a train of the Eizan Electric Railway or took the reverse route (from Sanjo Keihan, the person was supposed to buy an Eizan Electric Railway connection discount ticket before taking a bus; on the contrary, he/she was supposed to buy a Kyoto Bus discount ticket at the ticket gate of Demachiyanagi Station when connecting from a train of the Eizan Electric Railway to a Kyoto Bus).
sen.cmt: wickets→ gates と統一しています。
